div.div: Northern Hemisphere key records and trends for the Holocene.
div.p:
Temperature records from ( A) Greenland GISP2 ice core (
10 ), ( B) pollen from high- to mid-latitude areas with Scandinavia (
34 ) (black), 53°N to 62°N/18°E to 27°E area (green) and 43°N to 49°N/5°E to 13°E area (brown) (
4 ), ( C) Germany (NGT) (
20 ), and ( D) Switzerland speleothems (this study). Water isotope records from ( E) Switzerland speleothems (this study) and ( F) Greenland NGRIP ice core (
21 ). Precipitation records from ( G) Oman speleothem (
31 ) and ( H) Venezuela marine sediments (
41 ). Calcite oxygen isotope records from ( I) Switzerland (this study) and ( J) Germany (
27 ) (yellow) speleothems. On (J), calculated drip water values (δ 18O dw) (
20 ) are also shown (gray) and show a similar behavior as Milandre Cave water isotopes. Linear fits over the past 10,000 or 8000 years.
